com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentMedia<THIS extends FluentMedia<THIS>>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.event.ContextClickEvent.ContextClickNotifier, FluentAbstractComponent<THIS>, FluentClientConnector<THIS>, FluentComponent<THIS>, FluentContextClickNotifier<THIS>, FluentSizeable<THIS>, Serializable, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FluentAudio<THIS>, FluentVideo<THIS>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FAudio, FVideo

    public interface FluentMedia<THIS extends FluentMedia<THIS>>
extends FluentAbstractComponent<THIS>
    The base interface for fluent versions of AbstractMedia
    See Also:
    AbstractMedia

    • Method Detail

      • withAltText

        default THIS withAltText(String altText)
        Sets the alternative text to be displayed if the browser does not support HTML5. This text is rendered as HTML if withHtmlContentAllowed(boolean) is set to true. With HTML rendering, this method can also be used to implement fallback to a flash-based player, see the Mozilla Developer Network for details.
        Parameters:
        altText - the alternate text if video is unavailable
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setAltText(String)

      • withAutoplay

        default THIS withAutoplay(boolean autoplay)
        Sets whether the media is to automatically start playback when enough data has been loaded.
        Parameters:
        autoplay - if true, enable autoplay
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setAutoplay(boolean)

      • withHtmlContentAllowed

        default THIS withHtmlContentAllowed(boolean htmlContentAllowed)
        Set whether the alternative text (AbstractMedia.setAltText(String)) is rendered as HTML or not.
        Parameters:
        htmlContentAllowed - true if alternated text may contain html, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setHtmlContentAllowed(boolean)

      • withLoop

        default THIS withLoop(boolean loop)
        Enables or disables looping.
        Parameters:
        loop - if true, enable looping
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setLoop(boolean)

      • withMuted

        default THIS withMuted(boolean muted)
        Set whether to mute the audio or not.
        Parameters:
        muted - if true, media is muted
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setMuted(boolean)

      • withPreload

        default THIS withPreload(com.vaadin.shared.ui.PreloadMode preload)
        Sets the preload attribute that is intended to provide a hint to the browser how the media should be preloaded. Valid values are 'none', 'metadata', 'preload', see the Mozilla Developer Network for details.
        Parameters:
        preload - preload mode
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setPreload(PreloadMode)

      • withShowControls

        default THIS withShowControls(boolean showControls)
        Sets whether or not the browser should show native media controls.
        Parameters:
        showControls - if true, controls are visible
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setShowControls(boolean)

      • withSource

        default THIS withSource(com.vaadin.server.Resource source)
        Sets a single media file as the source of the media component.
        Parameters:
        source - the media source
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setSource(Resource)

      • withSources

        default THIS withSources(com.vaadin.server.Resource... sources)
        Set multiple sources at once. Which of the sources is used is selected by the browser depending on which file formats it supports. See wikipedia for a table of formats supported by different browsers.
        Parameters:
        sources - the media sources
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        AbstractMedia.setSources(Resource...)
